Title: Data Scientist - Marketing Technology
Description:
Location: Berlin, in-office

SumUp enables merchants around the world to get paid easily, process orders quickly, sell online instantly and manage their money more efficiently. We create tools that help merchants to build a thriving business.

The cross-functional MarTech team is collaboratively responsible for improving our customer acquisition. This includes optimizing our worldwide online marketing spendings, attributing new customers to marketing campaigns, automating content creation through AI, calculating the customer lifetime value of our merchants, and using data from various sources for analysis and decision making. Based on that data, we develop machine-learning models that help us achieve the above mentioned goals.

For that, we are looking for a passionate Data Scientist to complement our team. We will innovate, drive impact for our customers and SumUp, and have fun together.

What you‚Äôll do:


Work closely with stakeholders to build valuable solutions and enable them to use these efficiently
Analyse data to build and operate machine-learning models that predict user behaviour, optimise marketing spendings, or create marketing content using generative AI
Work on predictions and insights that contribute to shaping the direction of the company.
Be part of an international team spanning two continents and consisting of a Product Manager, Data Scientists, Software Engineers, and Data Engineers


You‚Äôll be great for this role if:


You have a degree in statistics, mathematics, economy, computer science or comparable
You have 2+ years of experience in data science
You bring experience in building, delivering, and continuously iterating machine learning models and algorithms end-to-end at scale
You possess experience in experimenting and measuring experiments (setting up a/b tests, lift tests or geo tests) and evaluating them
You have experience using Python with its scientific stack (e.g. pandas, sklearn, numpy, statsmodels, xgboost, matplotlib, seaborn) and knowledge of SQL
You bring great communication and data visualization skills and the ability to effectively convey complex insights to non-technical stakeholders, enhancing collaboration and informed decision-making
You embrace best practices for clean, maintainable and testable code


Why you should join SumUp


We‚Äôre a truly global team of 3200+ people from 80+ countries, spread across 4 continents
We are open to location based out of Berlin
We offer visa and relocation support for you, your family and even your pets
A dedicated annual Learning & Development budget for attending conferences and/or advancing your career through further education
Enrolment onto our virtual stock ownership program - you will own a stake in SumUp‚Äôs future success
The opportunity to work on large scale fintech products used by millions of businesses around the world
Corporate pension scheme
Numerous other benefits such as Urban Sports Club subsidy, Kita placement assistance, relocation assistance, subsidised office lunches and other location-tailored benefits


About SumUp

We believe in the everyday hero.

Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we create powerful, easy-to-use financial solutions to help them run their businesses. With a founder‚Äôs mentality and a 'team-first‚Äô attitude, our diverse teams across Europe, South America and the United States work together to ensure that the small business owners we partner with can be successful doing what they love.

SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. SumUp does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by company policy. SumUp also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.

SumUp will not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate.

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don‚Äôt tick every box, it‚Äôs ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Your Responsibilities

We are looking for a full-time for Python Developer to join in the R&D Bioinformatics team in Berlin, Rostock, Belgrade or Valencia. You will be responsible for developing new pipelines and improving current algorithms.


Guiding the development of diagnostic tools and applications
Implementing new and improving existing features in our software stack
Monitor automated data processing pipelines
Coordinate and plan new diagnostic methods with stakeholders, medical experts, and the diagnostics team
Ensuring a high quality of the developed software and the corresponding documentation


Your profile


At least 5+ years‚Äô experience working with Python and SQL, preferably with background in Biology, Medicine, or Genetics. NGS knowledge is a plus
Experience with python packages: Numpy, Pandas, sqlalchemy, Pydantic, FastAPI, Django and Flask.
Deep understanding of Python-application structure and organization
Experienced with software architecture
Experience with CI/CD Tools and command line (Jenkins, Terraform, Ansible, Git)
Must have experience with scalable cloud environments (AWS preferred).
Strong verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills, combined with good team spirit
Ability to set priorities, meet timelines and company objectives.


Why us?


Talents are individually supported by internal and external trainings
An international career in a multicultural environment
Regular company events form us as one team


About Us

With employees from over 50 nations, CENTOGENE is a truly global company located within the university city of Rostock, one of Germany's beautiful cities close to the Baltic sea.

We are dedicated to deliver data-driven, life-changing answers to patients, physicians, and biopharma partners to enable a world healed of rare and neurodegenerative diseases.

In this fast-paced and highly innovative area of biotech, those who want to work, learn, and contribute to a growing biotech company will find a dynamic and exciting environment at CENTOGENE.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - AI Integration Engineer
Description:
LINDERA, founded in 2017, is a pioneer in addressing the critical challenge of fall prevention among the aging population through advanced Computer Vision AI technology. Despite progress in elder care, falls remain a leading cause of injury among seniors, leading to decreased mobility, loss of independence, and a heavy burden on healthcare systems. Traditional methods for assessing fall risk often require specialized equipment and expertise, limiting their accessibility.




At LINDERA, we (r)evolutionize fall prevention by leveraging AI-driven 3D motion analysis, utilizing everyday smartphone cameras to analyze gait parameters. Our solution democratizes access to advanced gait analysis, allowing for accurate early detection of fall risks and personalized intervention strategies, ultimately improving the safety and quality of life for the elderly. As a dynamic leader at the intersection of digital health innovation and practical application, we are shaping the future of medical technology.


Tasks


The Role




As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer - AI Integration Engineer, you will be instrumental in developing AI solutions and integrating them into our production environments and on mobile devices. You will work on making our innovative AI models accessible and impactful in real-world healthcare applications.




Your Responsibilities





Develop, optimize, and integrate AI and deep learning models, particularly in computer vision, into production and mobile environments.


Utilize inference platforms such as ONNX and TensorRT to deploy AI models efficiently.


Write and maintain production-ready code in Python, focusing on performance and reliability.


Maintain and improve our codebase to meet day-to-day goals and ensure seamless integration with our technology stack.


Come up with smart ways to acquire, visualize, explore, and clean up large heterogeneous data to enhance model performance and usability.


Collaborate with cross-functional teams, such as clinical R&D specialists, product and software engineers, presenting your ideas, supporting other computer vision engineers, data scientists, and fostering a team-player environment with your solution driven mindset.


Ensure seamless integration of AI models into user-facing solutions, troubleshooting and refining as needed.



Requirements


Your Profile





A degree (BSc or MSc) in Computer Science, Mathematics/Statistics, Engineering, or a related field.


3+ years of experience in AI, deep learning, or computer vision, with a focus on real-world model integration.


Good knowledge of AI/ML solutions, algorithms, and best practices, with the ability to apply them to solve complex problems.


Experience working with large heterogeneous datasets, with a strong ability to manipulate, analyze, and derive insights from data.


Proficiency in Python, with hands-on experience using deep learning frameworks like PyTorch and inference platforms like ONNX and TensorRT.


Familiarity with app & software development (Kotlin, Swift and Rust) is a plus.


Familarity with MLOps (DVS) and DevOps Engineering tools, like Docker, Kubernetes and CI/CD pipeline like Gitlab runners.


A collaborative mindset, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to take initiative.


Fluent in English; German skills are a plus.


Willingness to work on-site in Berlin 3 days a week.



Benefits


What We Offer





Innovative and Unique Product ‚Äì At LINDERA, you will be a pioneer, actively shaping the digital future of healthcare with cutting-edge AI solutions. As a leader in 3D Motion Tracking, we set global standards in Mobility Assessment and Decision Intelligence. You will not only work with a unique product but also contribute to transforming care and medicine through our innovative technology.


Effective Structures and Open Communication ‚Äì We operate in a task-oriented manner with a flat hierarchy, allowing us to quickly adapt and fully leverage our team's potential. Our open communication fosters collaboration across all departments, ensuring that our products thrive on the collective expertise and ideas of our team.


Diverse and Challenging Role ‚Äì We navigate a dynamic and regulated healthcare market where every day brings new challenges. Our team embraces these challenges as opportunities to drive innovation, making our work both exciting and unique.


Freedom and Responsibility ‚Äì After onboarding and training, you will have the space to independently shape and pursue your goals. We value shared responsibility and trust in the skills of each team member to contribute meaningfully to our collective success.


Living LINDERA Values ‚Äì We have a strong sense of who we are and how we interact with each other. Our values guide our daily actions, and we continuously evolve them in the spirit of our organization.


Respectful and Solution-Oriented ‚Äì The foundation of our successful development is the respectful integration of different perspectives and ideas. We live this approach with a focus on solutions and mutual respect.


State-of-the-Art ‚Äì We work with the latest technologies, cutting-edge equipment, and modern working methods, regularly reflecting on our processes to stay ahead of the curve.


Inspiring Work Environment ‚Äì Our modern office in the heart of Kreuzberg, Berlin, offers excellent connectivity, a diverse infrastructure, and an atmosphere designed for collaboration and ambition.


Flexible and Competitive Benefits ‚Äì We offer a hybrid work environment with home-office flexibility and the opportunity to work remotely from anywhere for up to 2 weeks per year. Enjoy a competitive salary package, monthly contributions towards a company pension scheme, and the freedom to work in a way that best suits you.





LINDERA ‚Äì Move safely, live happily!

The Role


As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer - AI Integration Engineer, you will be instrumental in developing AI solutions and integrating them into our production environments and on mobile devices. You will work on making our innovative AI models accessible and impactful in real-world healthcare applications.


Your Responsibilities



  • Develop, optimize, and integrate AI and deep learning models, particularly in computer vision, into production and mobile environments.

  • Utilize inference platforms such as ONNX and TensorRT to deploy AI models efficiently.

  • Write and maintain production-ready code in Python, focusing on performance and reliability.

  • Maintain and improve our codebase to meet day-to-day goals and ensure seamless integration with our technology stack.

  • Come up with smart ways to acquire, visualize, explore, and clean up large heterogeneous data to enhance model performance and usability.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, such as clinical R&D specialists, product and software engineers, presenting your ideas, supporting other computer vision engineers, data scientists, and fostering a team-player environment with your solution driven mindset.

  • Ensure seamless integration of AI models into user-facing solutions, troubleshooting and refining as needed.


Requirements

Your Profile



  • A degree (BSc or MSc) in Computer Science, Mathematics/Statistics, Engineering, or a related field.

  • 3+ years of experience in AI, deep learning, or computer vision, with a focus on real-world model integration.

  • Good knowledge of AI/ML solutions, algorithms, and best practices, with the ability to apply them to solve complex problems.

  • Experience working with large heterogeneous datasets, with a strong ability to manipulate, analyze, and derive insights from data.

  • Proficiency in Python, with hands-on experience using deep learning frameworks like PyTorch and inference platforms like ONNX and TensorRT.

  • Familiarity with app & software development (Kotlin, Swift and Rust) is a plus.

  • Familarity with MLOps (DVS) and DevOps Engineering tools, like Docker, Kubernetes and CI/CD pipeline like Gitlab runners.

  • A collaborative mindset, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to take initiative.

  • Fluent in English; German skills are a plus.

  • Willingness to work on-site in Berlin 3 days a week.


Benefits

What We Offer



  • Innovative and Unique Product ‚Äì At LINDERA, you will be a pioneer, actively shaping the digital future of healthcare with cutting-edge AI solutions. As a leader in 3D Motion Tracking, we set global standards in Mobility Assessment and Decision Intelligence. You will not only work with a unique product but also contribute to transforming care and medicine through our innovative technology.

  • Effective Structures and Open Communication ‚Äì We operate in a task-oriented manner with a flat hierarchy, allowing us to quickly adapt and fully leverage our team's potential. Our open communication fosters collaboration across all departments, ensuring that our products thrive on the collective expertise and ideas of our team.

  • Diverse and Challenging Role ‚Äì We navigate a dynamic and regulated healthcare market where every day brings new challenges. Our team embraces these challenges as opportunities to drive innovation, making our work both exciting and unique.

  • Freedom and Responsibility ‚Äì After onboarding and training, you will have the space to independently shape and pursue your goals. We value shared responsibility and trust in the skills of each team member to contribute meaningfully to our collective success.

  • Living LINDERA Values ‚Äì We have a strong sense of who we are and how we interact with each other. Our values guide our daily actions, and we continuously evolve them in the spirit of our organization.

  • Respectful and Solution-Oriented ‚Äì The foundation of our successful development is the respectful integration of different perspectives and ideas. We live this approach with a focus on solutions and mutual respect.

  • State-of-the-Art ‚Äì We work with the latest technologies, cutting-edge equipment, and modern working methods, regularly reflecting on our processes to stay ahead of the curve.

  • Inspiring Work Environment ‚Äì Our modern office in the heart of Kreuzberg, Berlin, offers excellent connectivity, a diverse infrastructure, and an atmosphere designed for collaboration and ambition.

  • Flexible and Competitive Benefits ‚Äì We offer a hybrid work environment with home-office flexibility and the opportunity to work remotely from anywhere for up to 2 weeks per year. Enjoy a competitive salary package, monthly contributions towards a company pension scheme, and the freedom to work in a way that best suits you.


LINDERA ‚Äì Move safely, live happily!

Title: Senior Machine Learning Research Scientist (d/f/m) - Large-scale Machine Learning
Description:
Why us?

We believe that AI has the potential to revolutionize how cancer and other complex diseases are diagnosed and treated. We also believe that AI is a tool, not an identity ‚Äì without access to high-quality data and a scientifically rigorous, transparent approach to model development, AI is just a buzzword. That's where we come in.

Aignostics is a spin-off from one of Europe's largest and most prestigious university hospitals (Charit√©), with employees in Berlin and New York. We have received over $50M in funding from leading investors and are a growing team of over 100 interdisciplinary professionals. We work with academic partners as well as leading global life sciences companies.

As a Senior Machine Learning Research Scientist in Aignostics‚Äô foundation model team, you will work on developing large-scale self-supervised models. Together with collaborators in academia and industry you will push the state of the art in foundation models for digital pathology. Within our team of experts on large-scale machine learning and data handling, you will work on improving, benchmarking and extending our family of best-in-class foundations models, bridging image, text and other pathology data modalities. Moreover, using our foundation models you will contribute to developing prototypes for new applications to assist pathologists and generate new insights for improving cancer treatment.

This is a unique opportunity to join a fun, diverse, and growing team of 100+ data scientists, software developers, biologists, and pathologists to shape the next generation of cancer treatments. You will be part of a driven community that works in an agile, supportive and interdisciplinary research environment where your results make a difference to patients. In our established startup you have the opportunity to grow personally and technically, take responsibility and benefit from a dynamic work environment.

At Aignostics, we believe that fighting cancer is a job for people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures. We value and celebrate diversity and inclusion and are committed to offering equal employment and promotion opportunities for all applicants and employees. Applicants will be considered regardless of their age, disability, ethnicity, race, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, etc. We thrive through collaboration and believe the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Where your expertise is needed


Plan and execute interdisciplinary projects connecting machine learning, software engineering and biomedical domain knowledge
Research, pilot and evaluate novel self-supervised learning approaches for extracting insight from high-resolution biological images and other data modalities
Analyze experiments that you and others run, and form ideas and hypotheses to explain results
Run large-scale distributed machine learning experiments
Transform proof-of-concept machine learning models into automated, tested and production-ready systems
Support and mentor junior colleagues
Clearly communicate your results in internal and external presentations


What We Are Looking For


Ph.D or MSc. in a relevant field, e.g. Computer Science, Machine Learning or Bioinformatics
Eagerness to lead initiatives, learn new technologies and excel in a complex space
Solid theoretical foundations and at least 4+ years"developing novel machine learning techniques
Experience with developing large-scale self-supervised deep learning models ("Foundation Models") for vision, language, or multimodal applications
Advanced skills in Python, Linux, cloud computing and machine learning software stacks
Passion for clean code and high standards for quality assurance
Ability to independently define, organize and complete research projects
Excellent communication and team working skills


Bonus points for


Prior experience with digital pathology or medical imaging
Leadership experience in a research context
Hands-on experience with developing and integrating Vision Language Models (VLMs)


We are still keen to hear from you if you don't match all the above points! Our needs are diverse and growing and you are encouraged to apply if you have any combination of these skills. The recruitment process is a comparative exercise and decisions will be made based on the applications we review at each time.

Our offer


Join a purpose-driven start up: We are working collectively to fight cancer and improve patient outcomes. Come help us make a difference!
Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charit√©, TU Berlin and our other partners
Work with a welcoming, diverse and highly international team of colleagues
Opportunity to take responsibility and grow your role within the startup
Expand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development yearly budget of 1,000‚Ç¨ (plus 2 L&D days), language classes and internal development programs
Mentoring program, you‚Äôll learn from great experts
Flexible working hours and teleworking policy
Enjoy your well-deserved time off within our 28 paid vacations days per year
We are family & pet friendly and support flexible parental leave options
Pick a subsidized membership of your choice among public transport sports and well-being
Enjoy our social gatherings, lunches, and off-site events for a fun and inclusive work environment


Join us to make a difference!

About Us

Title: Social Insight Analyst
Description:
Your Tasks


Translate social media conversations and digital trends into clear, actionable insights for key stakeholders across the company
Monitor, analyze, and interpret social media and listening data using platforms like Netbase Quid or similar tools; turn findings into compelling reports and dashboards
Identify emerging trends, audience behaviors, and content patterns to support campaign development and innovation
Collaborate closely with marketing, PR, and sales teams to deliver timely and relevant social insights for both ongoing and upcoming initiatives
Contribute to pitches and client presentations with clear, data-driven storytelling
Continuously evaluate and test new social listening and analytics tools to enhance our insight capabilities
Stay on top of developments in the creator economy and influencer marketing landscape to help shape internal strategies


Your Profile


University degree in Marketing, Data Analytics, Business Administration, or a related field
Minimum of 3 years of professional experience in market research, data analysis, and social media marketing
Proven analytical skills with hands-on experience in data visualization and interpretation using tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R, or a strong willingness to deepen technical skills in this area
Advanced proficiency in social media tracking and listening tools such as Meltwater, Netbase Quid, or comparable platforms
Solid understanding of Generative AI tools and their application in analytics and content strategy
In-depth knowledge of the creator economy and a strong grasp of current social media trends and platform dynamics
Full professional fluency in both German and English, spoken and written
High level of adaptability and drive, with the ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced, agile work environment


About Us

We Are Era is the first pan-European studio and talent agency with offices in Amsterdam, Berlin, Cologne, Copenhagen, Paris, Milan and Stockholm. Our vision? Shaping the zeitgeist in an era of movements - and with success: our productions and campaigns for broadcasters, brands and NGOs have won multiple awards. We create stories with impact and attitude, developed and told by and for people all over Europe. Our projects range from TV productions and fictional series to innovative formats on social video platforms such as YouTube, Instagram, Twitch and TikTok. We develop social influencers and artists into cross-platform personality brands that are now found on social media, on TV, in podcasts, on the big screen or in the music charts. Our international team of 250 speaks all languages - from mainstream to subculture, from the Friday For Future movement to K-pop culture. Together, we offer our partners the fast-lane ticket to every community in Europe. Are you ready to shape the zeitgeist with us? Join the Movement!

We Are Era is the first pan-European studio and talent agency with offices in Amsterdam, Berlin, Cologne, Copenhagen, Paris, Milan and Stockholm. Our vision? Shaping the zeitgeist in an era of movements - and with success: our productions and campaigns for broadcasters, brands and NGOs have won multiple awards. We create stories with impact and attitude, developed and told by and for people all over Europe. Our projects range from TV productions and fictional series to innovative formats on social video platforms such as YouTube, Instagram, Twitch and TikTok. We develop social influencers and artists into cross-platform personality brands that are now found on social media, on TV, in podcasts, on the big screen or in the music charts. Our international team of 250 speaks all languages - from mainstream to subculture, from the Friday For Future movement to K-pop culture. Together, we offer our partners the fast-lane ticket to every community in Europe. Are you ready to shape the zeitgeist with us? Join the Movement!

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (d/f/m)
Description:
Why us?

We believe that AI has the potential to revolutionize how cancer and other complex diseases are diagnosed and treated. We also believe that AI is a tool, not an identity ‚Äì without access to high quality data and a scientifically rigorous, transparent approach to model development, AI is just a buzzword. That‚Äôs where we come in.

Aignostics is a spin-off from one of Europe's largest and most prestigious university hospitals (Charit√©), with employees in Berlin and New York. We have received over $50M in funding from leading investors and are a growing team of over 100 interdisciplinary professionals. We work with academic partners as well as leading global life sciences companies.

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer (d/f/m) at Aignostics, you work hand in hand with our collaborators in academia and industry to push the state of the art of machine learning for digital pathology. You will develop distributed software systems for machine learning applications that will help to improve cancer research and diagnostics. Together with your colleagues you will take care of the machine learning software stack and thereby enable our teams to build medical grade quality and scalable machine learning models.

At Aignostics, we believe that fighting cancer is a job for people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures. We value and celebrate diversity and inclusion and are committed to offering equal employment and promotion opportunities for all applicants and employees. Applicants will be considered regardless of their age, disability, ethnicity, race, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, etc. We thrive through collaboration and believe the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Please note that this position is intended for software engineers. For a data scientist / machine learning / deep learning position please check out our Data Scientist opening.

Where your expertise is needed


Design, develop, deploy and maintain robust ML pipelines to make them usable, efficient and scalable.
Optimize and fine-tune data pipelines for production.
Engage in code reviews, upholding high standards for clean, reliable code.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into ML solutions.
Embrace learning new technologies, fostering innovation, and tackling diverse challenges. Contribute to the development of our ML infrastructure, pipelines, services, monitoring systems and codebase in general.
Work in an agile development environment and clearly communicate your results to the team.
Mentor and guide junior engineers, providing technical leadership and insights.


What We Are Looking For


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field. PhD is a plus.
4+ years of work experience in software development, machine learning or a related field.
Advanced programming skills in Python, with experience with other languages (e.g. C/C++, CUDA, Java, Rust) being a plus
Good understanding of distributed systems and frameworks, parallel computing and scalability.
Experience with cloud platforms (GCP, AWS or Azure), familiarity with MLOps / DevOps best practices (incl. CI/CD, Docker, Kubernetes and observability).
Dedicated to high coding standards and knowledgeable about best practices in development workflow.
Experience with Linux, version control and container technologies.
Data engineering skills, experience with working with large datasets.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.


Nice to have


Experience with deploying models into production.
Experience with Google Kubernetes Engine, Ray distributed computing framework and Prefect.
Hands-on experience with machine learning and data science. Proven experience with ML framework, such as Tensorflow, PyTorch or scikit-learn.
Experience with working on biomedical data (especially working with image data).
Experience with software development in regulated environments, specifically considering Information Security criteria under ISO 27001


We are still keen to hear from you if you don't match all the above points! Our needs are diverse and growing and you are encouraged to apply if you have any combination of these skills. The recruitment process is a comparative exercise and decisions will be made based on the applications we review at each time.

Our offer


Join a purpose-driven startup: We are working collectively to fight cancer and improve patient outcomes. Come help us make a difference!
Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charit√©, TU Berlin and our other partners
Work with a welcoming, diverse and highly international team of colleagues
Opportunity to take responsibility and grow your role within the startup
Expand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development yearly budget of 1,000‚Ç¨ (plus 2 L&D days), language classes and internal development programs
Mentoring program, you‚Äôll learn from great experts
Flexible working hours and teleworking policy
Enjoy your well-deserved time off within our 28 paid vacations days per year
We are family & pet friendly and support flexible parental leave options
Pick a subsidized membership of your choice among public transport sports and well-being
Enjoy our social gatherings, lunches, and off-site events for a fun and inclusive work environment


Join us to make a difference!

About Us

WIR HELFEN ZU HEILEN | CONTRIBUTING TO SAVING LIVES

Die Eckert & Ziegler Radiopharma GmbH, eine Tochtergesellschaft der renommierten und international agierenden Eckert & Ziegler Gruppe, ist seit √ºber 20 Jahren ein wichtiger und verl√§sslicher Partner der radiopharmazeutischen Community.

Radiopharmazeutika sind aus der heutigen Medizin nicht mehr wegzudenken. Besonders in der Forschung und Entwicklung neuer Therapiem√∂glichkeiten, aber auch in der Behandlung und Diagnostik verschiedenster Arten von Krebserkrankungen spielen sie eine bedeutende Rolle. Aus diesem Grund versorgen wir Kliniken, pharmazeutische Unternehmen und Institute mit GMP-gerecht hergestellten Radioisotopen sowie Radiopharmaka und entwickeln ma√ügeschneiderte L√∂sungen f√ºr forschende Unternehmen. Mit unserer Unterst√ºtzung entstehen neue Verfahren und Methoden von der Entwicklung bis zur Produktion.

Werden Sie Teil unseres ambitionierten und hochqualifizierten Teams und helfen zu heilen.

Ihr Beitrag zum Erfolg


Vorbereitung, Durchf√ºhrung, Nachbereitung und Dokumentation der Herstellung von radioaktiven Arzneimitteln
Lagerverwaltung
Durchf√ºhrung von Validierungs- und Qualifizierungsaktivit√§ten in der Produktion
Mitwirkung bei Wartung und Instandhaltung der Anlagen und Ger√§te
Einhaltung und Durchf√ºhrung von Hygienema√ünahmen in den Reinr√§umen
Erstellung von GMP-relevanten Dokumenten


Das qualifiziert Sie


Erfolgreich abgeschlossene Ausbildung zum/zur Chemielaborant/in, CTA, PTA, Chemikant/in oder vergleichbare Qualifikation
Erste Berufserfahrung in der Herstellung von Arzneimitteln
Idealerweise Erfahrung im Umgang mit GMP
Affinit√§t zur technischen Dokumentation
Selbstst√§ndiges, konzentriertes und pr√§zises Arbeiten
Verhandlungssichere Deutschkenntnisse (min. B2-Niveau) in Wort und Schrift sowie Grundkenntnisse in Englisch


Freuen Sie sich auf


Flexibilit√§t: Gestaltung der Arbeitszeit durch flexible Arbeitszeiten und anlassbezogene bezahlte Freistellungen (z.B. Umzug oder Termine zur Krebsvorsorge) f√ºr eine optimale Work-Life-Balance
Familienfreundlichkeit: Unterst√ºtzung bei der Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf, durch bezahlte Freistellungen f√ºr famili√§re Ereignisse, wie z.B. Kind-krank-Tage, Familienstartzeit oder die eigene Hochzeit
Arbeitskomfort: angenehme Arbeitsumgebung ohne Gro√ü-Raum-B√ºro und Schichtarbeit sowie ergonomische Tische und St√ºhle f√ºr Komfort am Arbeitsplatz
Verg√ºtungspaket: Attraktive Verg√ºtung sowie verm√∂genswirksame Leistungen und Sachbezugsgutscheine oder JobTicket
Urlaubs- und Erholungszeit: 30 Tage Urlaub f√ºr regelm√§√üige Erholung und zum Energie tanken
Stabilit√§t & Perspektive: Sicherer Arbeitsplatz in einem etablierten Unternehmen mit langfristigen Perspektiven und Entwicklungsm√∂glichkeiten
Gesundheitsf√∂rderung: betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement mit Gesundheitstagen und Aktionen wie "Fit und aktiv in den Tag" - die Gesundheit unserer Mitarbeitenden liegt uns am Herzen
Mobilit√§tsvielfalt: JobTicket, E-Bike-Leasing, eine gute √ñPNV-Anbindung sowie firmeneigene Ladestationen f√ºr E-Autos und die M√∂glichkeit zur kostenlosen Ladung von E-Bike-Akkus f√ºr eine nachhaltige Mobilit√§t


Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung!

Bitte bewerben Sie sich √ºber unser Online-Bewerbungsformular, das Sie am Ende jedes Stellenangebots √ºber den Button "Jetzt bewerben!" erreichen.

Auf der Suche nach neuen Talenten freuen wir uns √ºber jede Bewerbung, unabh√§ngig von Geschlecht, Alter, Herkunft, sexueller Identit√§t, Behinderung, Religion oder Weltanschauung. Wir legen Wert auf Vielfalt und sch√§tzen die unterschiedlichen Perspektiven, die Sie in unser Unternehmen einbringen k√∂nnen. Wir freuen uns auch √ºber Ihre Bewerbung, wenn Sie nicht alle Kriterien erf√ºllen, denn individuelle F√§higkeiten, Motivation und Potenzial sind uns wichtiger als Klassifizierungen.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (f/m/x)
Description:
Company Description

We are seeking a technically skilled and passionate Senior Data Scientist to join our dynamic Data Science department at AUTO1 Group Technology. As part of our disruptive approach in the used car market, our team leverages cutting-edge technology to develop Machine Learning solutions that optimize our platforms and processes. AUTO1 Group is Europe's leading digital automotive platform. We revolutionize the used car market with our well-known brands Autohero, wirkaufendeinauto.de, and AUTO1.com.

Job Description


Translate business needs into data science questions and take ownership of the research and development of Machine Learning solutions that bring positive business impact
Partner with engineering and product teams to deploy Data Science services and embed them in the Auto1 tech infrastructure
Monitor model performance in production, share results with stakeholders and develop actionable next steps
Identify business opportunities and collaborate with stakeholders and partners in tech to drive growth
Set priorities and support junior members to achieve project goals


Qualifications


At least 2 years of hands-on experience working with deep learning/neural networks. Experience with recommender system and pytorch would be considered an advantage
Proficiency in SQL and Python for data manipulation, analysis, and modeling. Experience in AWS/Azure/Google Cloud would be considered an advantage.
Proficiency in the full lifecycle of data science projects, including initializing/designing, developing (building the model), and deploying models in production (full stack)
Advanced statistical and quantitative knowledge with commercial experience, preferably with academic experience in a quantitative research field
Demonstrated strong stakeholder interaction and visualization skills to effectively present findings in a clear and unambiguous way


Additional Information


Working from home: you can work from home up to 5 days a week
International teams
Educational budget to support your continuous learning and development
Personal growth with the contribution of own ideas
Exciting team events like Hackathons to foster collaboration and innovation
Discounts at Autohero, our platform for high-quality used cars


Contact

Lina Antoniuk

At AUTO1 Group we live an open culture, believe in direct communication, and value diversity. We welcome every applicant; regardless of gender, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual identity, disability, or any other non-merit factor.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Research Scientist (d/f/m) - Large-scale Machine Learning
Description:
Why us?

We believe that AI has the potential to revolutionize how cancer and other complex diseases are diagnosed and treated. We also believe that AI is a tool, not an identity ‚Äì without access to high-quality data and a scientifically rigorous, transparent approach to model development, AI is just a buzzword. That's where we come in.

Aignostics is a spin-off from one of Europe's largest and most prestigious university hospitals (Charit√©), with employees in Berlin and New York. We have received over $50M in funding from leading investors and are a growing team of over 100 interdisciplinary professionals. We work with academic partners as well as leading global life sciences companies.

As a Senior Machine Learning Research Scientist in Aignostics‚Äô foundation model team, you will work on developing large-scale self-supervised models. Together with collaborators in academia and industry you will push the state of the art in foundation models for digital pathology. Within our team of experts on large-scale machine learning and data handling, you will work on improving, benchmarking and extending our family of best-in-class foundations models, bridging image, text and other pathology data modalities. Moreover, using our foundation models you will contribute to developing prototypes for new applications to assist pathologists and generate new insights for improving cancer treatment.

This is a unique opportunity to join a fun, diverse, and growing team of 100+ data scientists, software developers, biologists, and pathologists to shape the next generation of cancer treatments. You will be part of a driven community that works in an agile, supportive and interdisciplinary research environment where your results make a difference to patients. In our established startup you have the opportunity to grow personally and technically, take responsibility and benefit from a dynamic work environment.

At Aignostics, we believe that fighting cancer is a job for people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures. We value and celebrate diversity and inclusion and are committed to offering equal employment and promotion opportunities for all applicants and employees. Applicants will be considered regardless of their age, disability, ethnicity, race, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, etc. We thrive through collaboration and believe the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Where your expertise is needed


Plan and execute interdisciplinary projects connecting machine learning, software engineering and biomedical domain knowledge
Research, pilot and evaluate novel self-supervised learning approaches for extracting insight from high-resolution biological images and other data modalities
Analyze experiments that you and others run, and form ideas and hypotheses to explain results
Run large-scale distributed machine learning experiments
Transform proof-of-concept machine learning models into automated, tested and production-ready systems
Support and mentor junior colleagues
Clearly communicate your results in internal and external presentations


What We Are Looking For


Ph.D or MSc. in a relevant field, e.g. Computer Science, Machine Learning or Bioinformatics
Eagerness to lead initiatives, learn new technologies and excel in a complex space
Solid theoretical foundations and at least 4+ years"developing novel machine learning techniques
Experience with developing large-scale self-supervised deep learning models ("Foundation Models") for vision, language, or multimodal applications
Advanced skills in Python, Linux, cloud computing and machine learning software stacks
Passion for clean code and high standards for quality assurance
Ability to independently define, organize and complete research projects
Excellent communication and team working skills


Bonus points for


Prior experience with digital pathology or medical imaging
Leadership experience in a research context
Hands-on experience with developing and integrating Vision Language Models (VLMs)


We are still keen to hear from you if you don't match all the above points! Our needs are diverse and growing and you are encouraged to apply if you have any combination of these skills. The recruitment process is a comparative exercise and decisions will be made based on the applications we review at each time.

Our offer


Join a purpose-driven start up: We are working collectively to fight cancer and improve patient outcomes. Come help us make a difference!
Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charit√©, TU Berlin and our other partners
Work with a welcoming, diverse and highly international team of colleagues
Opportunity to take responsibility and grow your role within the startup
Expand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development yearly budget of 1,000‚Ç¨ (plus 2 L&D days), language classes and internal development programs
Mentoring program, you‚Äôll learn from great experts
Flexible working hours and teleworking policy
Enjoy your well-deserved time off within our 28 paid vacations days per year
We are family & pet friendly and support flexible parental leave options
Pick a subsidized membership of your choice among public transport sports and well-being
Enjoy our social gatherings, lunches, and off-site events for a fun and inclusive work environment


Join us to make a difference!

About Us

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - Python - AI / Supply Chain
Description:
Job Title: Machine Learning Engineer

Location: Berlin (Hybrid or Remote within Germany)

Job Type: Full-time

Industry: AI / Supply Chain Technology

Language Requirements: English (Fluent), German is a +

Salary: ‚Ç¨90,000 - ‚Ç¨120,000




The Company:

My client is an innovative and fast-growing company operating at the intersection of artificial intelligence and supply chain optimisation. With a strong focus on digital transformation and data-driven decision-making, they are developing a platform that helps industrial companies build resilient, transparent supply chains through intelligent, automated insights.




The company is well-funded, already working with recognised names in the industry, and is now scaling its team to support the next phase of growth.




About the Role:

They're looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join their high-performing AI team. This is a hands-on role focused on developing, deploying, and maintaining production-grade ML models that power key product features. You‚Äôll work closely with data scientists, software engineers, and product managers to build intelligent solutions that solve real-world supply chain challenges.




Key Responsibilities:

Design and implement scalable ML models for production use
Collaborate with product and data teams to define modelling goals and success metrics
Preprocess and analyse structured and unstructured data
Develop training pipelines, model validation processes, and evaluation frameworks
Deploy models using containerisation tools (e.g. Docker) and cloud infrastructure (e.g. AWS, GCP)
Monitor performance and continuously improve model accuracy and efficiency
Write clean, reproducible, and well-documented code




Requirements:

6 years + experience with Python and ML libraries (e.g. scikit-learn, XGBoost, TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Proficiency in data manipulation using tools like Pandas, NumPy, and SQL
Experience training and deploying ML models in a production environment
Solid understanding of ML concepts including feature engineering, cross-validation, and model evaluation
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) and container tools (Docker, Kubernetes)
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently as well as collaboratively




Desirable:

Experience working with supply chain or procurement data
Exposure to NLP techniques (e.g. text classification, embeddings, transformers)
Experience with MLOps tools and model monitoring solutions
Background in computer science, data science, applied maths, or a related field




What‚Äôs on Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package
Flexible working hours and a remote-friendly culture
A collaborative, supportive team environment
Opportunities for career development and skill-building
A chance to make a meaningful impact at a forward-thinking company

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
AI Engineer

Location: Berlin/Hybrid




We are seeking a talented and driven AI Engineer to join fast-growing AI start-up, REMATIQ. This is an exciting opportunity to work on cutting-edge AI solutions that are transforming regulatory affairs. As an AI Engineer, you will take ownership of designing, building, and scaling machine learning systems that drive impactful innovation in the industry.




Responsibilities

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and deploy machine learning models into production.
Build and optimize scalable and efficient machine learning pipelines for data processing, model training, and deployment.
Lead efforts in identifying, implementing, and validating the best algorithms and techniques for solving business challenges.
Take ownership of model performance, monitoring, and continuous improvement in production.
Mentor junior team members and contribute to fostering a collaborative engineering culture.
Research and stay up-to-date on advancements in machine learning, MLOps, and related technologies.
Contribute to the development of best practices in model lifecycle management, including reproducibility and version control.




Requirements

Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or AI Engineer in a similar role, with expertise in Python.Strong track record of delivering production-grade machine learning systems, including model deployment and monitoring.
Proficiency in at least one of the following areas:
Data Science: Advanced analytics, statistical modeling, and insights generation.
MLOps: Building robust CI/CD pipelines for machine learning workflows and automation.
Large Language Models (LLMs): Fine-tuning, training, or deploying state-of-the-art transformer-based models.Natural Language Processing (NLP): Developing applications like text classification, summarization, or entity recognition.
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and containerization tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to prioritize tasks effectively in a fast-paced environment.
Familiarity with scalable data storage and processing systems (e.g., Spark, Hadoop, or similar).
Passion for leveraging AI to revolutionize regulatory affairs.




Nice-to-Have Skills

Experience working in an early-stage start-up
Familiarity with regulatory affairs or compliance-related applications.
Contributions to open-source machine learning projects.
Expertise in deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Strong software engineering practices, including code reviews, testing, and documentation.




Why Join Us?

Innovative Mission: Be part of transforming regulatory affairs with cutting-edge AI technology.

Impactful Role: Take ownership of significant projects and contribute to shaping the future of the industry.

Collaborative Environment: Work with a small, ambitious team where everyone has real ownership over the product and company.

Growth Opportunities: Learn and grow in a fast-paced start-up environment with continuous professional development.

Compensation: Competitive salary and a generous equity package for early employees..




Join REMATIQ and be a driving force in revolutionizing regulatory affairs through AI. If you are a passionate and skilled AI Engineer ready to make an impact, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Title: Student AI Engineer - Finetuning LLMs (20 hours/week)
Description:
The Role:
This position is ideal for ambitious individuals with a solid AI background who are eager to gain hands-on experience in fine-tuning Large Language Models (LLMs). You will work closely with an experienced Senior AI Engineer, leverage cutting-edge technologies, and grow within an innovative startup environment. For candidates nearing graduation, there is also the opportunity to transition into a full-time role.




About Us:
Zapdeck is revolutionizing the way presentations are created. With our AI-powered software, users can generate professionally designed slides in just minutes. Our innovative AI technology transforms text directly into visually compelling slide designs, supported by an intuitive editor that simplifies storyline development and layout design.We operate in a multi-billion-dollar market that is being redefined by Generative AI. Backed by a pre-seed investment, we are building partnerships with leading companies and working on a multi-modal, agent-based system that utilizes the latest AI models.


Tasks



Support the development of AI agents


Execute fine-tuning processes for LLMs using an existing server setup and prepared datasets


Systematically test and optimize open-source models and their hyperparameters


Implement and improve Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems


Contribute to the development of multi-modal model approaches (text + image)


Apply modern quantization and fine-tuning techniques (LoRA, QLoRA, Bitsandbytes)



Requirements



Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field


At least 1 year of practical experience (e.g. from student projects, internships, or relevant work experience)


Solid understanding of the Hugging Face ecosystem (Transformers, Datasets) and PyTorch


Hands-on experience in fine-tuning LLMs


Experience with multi-modal models, RAG, or agent-based systems is a plus


Ability to work independently and in a structured manner



Benefits



Flexible work arrangements: remote work or one in-person office day per week in Berlin-Mitte, with flexible hours


Fair compensation and the opportunity to gain valuable real-world experience in a dynamic team


The chance to contribute to the development of innovative AI technologies and gain insights into building a successful startup


Clear path to a future full-time role, supported by a talent funding program to partially cover employment costs





We look forward to your application!

Why us?

We believe that AI has the potential to revolutionize how cancer and other complex diseases are diagnosed and treated. We also believe that AI is a tool, not an identity ‚Äì without access to high quality data and a scientifically rigorous, transparent approach to model development, AI is just a buzzword. That‚Äôs where we come in.

Aignostics is a spin-off from one of Europe's largest and most prestigious university hospitals (Charit√©), with employees in Berlin and New York. We have received over $50M in funding from leading investors and are a growing team of over 100 interdisciplinary professionals. We work with academic partners as well as leading global life sciences companies.

As a Senior Data Scientist at Aignostics, you work hand in hand with our collaborators in academia and industry to push the state of the art of machine learning for digital pathology. You translate biomedical challenges into concrete machine learning research roadmaps and coordinate their execution. Together with your colleagues you develop elegant solutions to complex problems, conduct rigorous experiments and finally convince your stakeholders with crystal clear presentations.

At Aignostics, we believe that fighting cancer is a job for people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures. We value and celebrate diversity and inclusion and are committed to offering equal employment and promotion opportunities for all applicants and employees. Applicants will be considered regardless of their age, disability, ethnicity, race, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, etc. We thrive through collaboration and believe the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Where your expertise is needed

  • Plan and execute interdisciplinary projects connecting machine learning, software engineering and biomedical domain knowledge
  • Research, pilot and evaluate novel computer vision approaches for extracting insight from high-resolution biological images
  • Transform proof-of-concept machine learning models into automated, tested and production-ready systems
  • Support and mentor junior colleagues
  • Clearly communicate your results in internal and external presentations

What We Are Looking For

  • Ph.D or MSc. in a relevant field, e.g. Computer Science, Machine Learning or Bioinformatics
  • Eagerness to lead initiatives, learn new technologies and excel in a complex space
  • Solid theoretical foundations and several years of experience developing novel machine learning techniques
  • Advanced skills in Python, Linux, cloud computing and machine learning software stacks
  • Passion for clean code and high standards for quality assurance
  • Ability to independently define, organize and complete research projects
  • Excellent communication and team working skills Bonus points for
  • Experience with development of deep learning models for computer vision
  • Exposure to biomedical data
  • Leadership experience in a research context

We are still keen to hear from you if you don't match all the above points! Our needs are diverse and growing and you are encouraged to apply if you have any combination of these skills. The recruitment process is a comparative exercise and decisions will be made based on the applications we review at each time.

Our offer

  • Join a purpose-driven start up: We are working collectively to fight cancer and improve patient outcomes. Come help us make a difference!
  • Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charit√©, TU Berlin and our other partners
  • Work with a welcoming, diverse and highly international team of colleagues
  • Opportunity to take responsibility and grow your role within the startup
  • Expand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development budget, language classes and internal development programs
  • Mentoring program, you‚Äôll learn from great experts
  • Flexible working hours and teleworking policy
  • Enjoy your well-deserved time off within our 28 paid vacations days per year
  • We are family & pet friendly and support flexible parental leave options
  • Pick a subsidized membership of your choice among public transport sports and well-being
  • Enjoy our social gatherings, lunches, and off-site events for a fun and inclusive work environment

Join us to make a difference!

About Us

aignostics.com

Title: DevOps/ML Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
At Machine Learning Reply, we work with our customers on cutting-edge projects for which we are looking for DevOps and ML Engineers to support our customer projects around machine learning and data processing across various industries. To expand our team, we are looking for a talented and highly skilled consultant with a technical background to join our team. As a consultant, you will be responsible for providing expert advice and technical support to our clients.

If you're a DevOps or ML Engineer or just starting out in the field of machine learning and/or DevOps engineering - if you never lose focus, love coding, data and AI, and are passionate about bringing your ideas to life - then we want to hear from you!

Responsibilities:


Design innovative, technical approaches for data intensive and applications with a focus on machine learning and artificial intelligence.
Implement and take ownership for your solutions on in either cloud based (AWS, Azure or GCP) and/or on-premises infrastructures of our customers.
Automate recurring tasks by state-of-the-art DevOps and MLOps concepts, enabling your customers to significantly reduce their time-to-delivery.
Take care of the necessary‚ÄØmonitoring, failover, and recovery infrastructures‚ÄØthat allow our customers save operation of their machine learning solutions in agreement with latest regulatory requirements
Closely‚ÄØinteract with customers and stakeholders‚ÄØto translate concrete and complex business requirements into production-ready‚ÄØsolutions
Collaborate with various disciplines‚ÄØsuch as enterprise architects, analysts,‚ÄØdata scientists or‚ÄØdata engineers‚ÄØto develop data-intensive applications such as data warehouses, data lakes and/or data platforms



What we offer you:


Access to work on projects across industries (large and mid-market companies in Banking, Insurance, Automotive, Retail, etc.)
Broaden your skills through interdisciplinary work and training in the areas of data engineering, cloud architecture, and data science
Benefit from industry-leading cooperations in the cloud, BI, and AutoML field
Very active social program - including training, conferences, team buildings, Reply Exchange, communities of practices, and hackathons
Work in an open, flat environment, within a broad Reply knowledge-sharing network
Award-winning office space in downtown Munich with access to ‚ÄúStammstrecke‚Äù
You choose your state-of-the-art equipment
Public transport ticket with Deutschlandticket
Gym-membership subsidy for a gym of your choice
Flexible work environment between client, Reply office, and remote work



Minimum Job Requirements / Qualifications:


Bachelor‚Äôs / master‚Äôs degree in computer science or any other related fileds (e.g. engineering, statistics, physics).
First practical experience with DevOps/MLOps principals and computing platforms like Microsoft Azure, AWS and GCP as well as Databricks.
Ability to convincingly communicate and present analytical results to management.
We cover the full lifecycle of Data, from Cloud Infrastructure, Data Engineering, Data Analytics, and Visualization to ML Engineering to and MLOps. Interest and/or experience in some of those fields is an advantage.
Fluent in English and able to speak German at least at a B2 Level.



Desired:


Working experience in cloud technologies (AWS, Azure or GCP), Kubernetes and programming languages like Python, Java and Scala.
Practical experience with SQL and NoSQL database technologies and data lakes
Experience with big data technologies (Apache Spark), data streaming (Apache Kafka) and workflow orchestration (Apache Airflow, Dagster)

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
The ideal candidate's favorite words are learning, data, scale, and agility. You will leverage your strong collaboration skills and ability to extract valuable insights from highly complex data sets to ask the right questions and find the right answers.¬†

¬†

Responsibilities

Analyze raw data: assessing quality, cleansing, structuring for downstream processing
Design accurate and scalable prediction algorithms
Collaborate with engineering team to bring analytical prototypes to production
Generate actionable insights for business improvements




Qualifications

Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in quantative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
At least 1 - 2 years' of experience in quantitative analytics or data modeling
Good understanding of predictive modeling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithms
Fluency in a programming language (Python, SQL)
Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools (Cassandra, Hadoop, Spark, Tableau)

Title: Science Manager (m/f/d)
Company: MAX BORN INSTITUTE for Nonlinear Optics and Short Pulse Spectroscopy
Description:
A Science Manager position is available in the Division of Precision Physics (Scientific Director: Nathalie Picqu√©) at the Max Born Institute in Berlin, Germany. We are looking for someone who will assist in implementing the director's scientific vision and division strategy.

We invite applications for the position of Science Manager (m/f/d)

Job Profile

The Project Manager will


Work closely with the Scientific Director and the Direction Team to assist in the general management of the Division and other management tasks.
Assist the Scientific Director with management and reporting, budget management, procurement, publications and teaching and dissemination activities.
Prepare reports, letters and presentations for internal and external stakeholders, including evaluation and annual reports.
Assist with research project documentation and compliance with institutional and funding guidelines.
Oversee science communication, including public outreach and event planning. Develop and implement social media strategy. Create and update website content.
Represent the Director in internal and external communications related to the management and presentation of the Division.
Assist in the recruitment and onboarding of research staff. Facilitate professional development opportunities for junior researchers within the Division.
Participate in the organisation of activities and initiatives within the Division.
Act as a point of contact for research related administrative issues.


Requirements


You have completed a doctoral degree, preferably in Atomic, Molecular and Optical Physics or related disciplines or you have extensive previous experience in science management. You are excited about science in general and interested in working at the interface between research and administration. Some experience, demonstrated interest and/or talent in organisational and management roles, preferably in an academic context, is an advantage.
You will have excellent written and oral communication skills in both English and German. The working language will be English.
Experience in writing and editing reports and documents in the areas of research project management, research evaluation and/or science communication is a plus.
You have excellent interpersonal skills and are a team player.
You have a flexible and proactive approach to work, including the ability to set and change priorities.
You have a high level of integrity and are able to handle sensitive and confidential information.
You are highly reliable and have good time management skills.
You are service oriented, interested in learning new tasks, able to manage projects in a multi-tasking manner, handle multiple requests and meet deadlines.
You will have excellent computer skills, including a working knowledge of writing, presentation and illustration softwares (preferably Word, Excel, Keynote, Adobe).


Our Offer

We offer interesting, challenging, and varied tasks at the interface between science, administration, and management in a highly topical field of research. You will be part of a highly collaborative and international team embedded in a unique world-leading research environment. We offer a pleasant, creative, and dynamic work environment at the forefront of science, regular opportunities for further education and training, and long-term career support within and beyond academia. The position is initially for two years with the possibility of extension. Part-time employment may be considered. Remuneration is based on the German public service pay scale (TV√∂D-Bund) according to education, training, qualifications and professional experience. Benefits will be in line with public service regulations. Applications will be accepted immediately and the position will remain open until filled. Starting dates in 2025 may be flexible.

In case of equal qualifications, preference will be given to severely disabled persons.

MBI is an equal-opportunity employer and places particular emphasis on promoting career opportunities for women.

Qualified women are therefore strongly encouraged to apply. MBI supports the compatibility of work and family life and is certified as a family-friendly employer by the audit berufundfamilie.

Please use the MBI online recruiting platform at https://mbi-berlin.de/career to upload your application with a cover letter (explaining your background and motivation), CV (with publication list if applicable), work certificates and transcripts (translated into English or German if applicable). Even for pre-application enquiries, we strongly encourage potential applicants to always send a CV, as this will help us to answer any questions they may have.

For further information and enquiries, please contact Prof. Dr. Nathalie Picqu√© (nathalie.picque@mbi-berlin.de).
Show more

Title: Data Science Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

Billie's Analytics team is at the heart of the company supporting multiple functions to make data-driven decisions. Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

We are looking for a diligent Data Science Analyst to join Billie's Analytics team and contribute to the development and enhancement of Billie's analytical capabilities.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

The ideal candidate is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable working on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, and is able to document effectively.

This is a unique opportunity for analysts who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of fintech business, develop additional skills, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

You Will


Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
Support product segments in creating effective tracking and measurement plans to ensure the impact of new features align with our product strategy
Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
Create, maintain and update dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
Enhance data processes, identify gaps, and streamline data collection
Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie's portfolio
Use statistics and ML concepts in developing actionable business solutions
Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who We Are Looking For


3-5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
Proficiency in advanced data and analytics and statistical concepts, tools, and methodologies
Prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
Ability to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
Strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
Experience working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong sense of responsibility, self-motivation, organizational skills, planning abilities, capacity to work independently and meet deadlines
Experience with Python, R and other advanced analytical tools
Previous experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage


What We Offer


Challenging and impactful work that drives personal and professional growth
One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
A hybrid working approach that allows you to work from home for up to 3 days per week
Enjoy 30 days vacation per year on top of paid public holidays, sabbatical opportunities, and extra child sickness leave for parents
Our ‚ÄúCatch a Ride with Billie‚Äù program that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG), Deutschland-Ticket, OR JobRad
A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
Free German group classes
An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 40 nationalities represented
Building meaningful connections with your colleagues through company and team events, interest groups, game nights, and more, powered by our Formula Fun Team!


Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You‚Äôll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.

Please Note

Our policy includes a 180-day waiting period before reconsidering candidates for the same role. This ensures a fair and thorough evaluation of all applicants. If you apply within this cool-off period, your application will be automatically rejected.

Thank you for your understanding.

Mit √ºber 30 Jahren Erfahrung in der Branche konzentriert sich das Unternehmen darauf, robuste Systeme f√ºr die D√ºnnschichtabscheidung, Mustererstellung und Charakterisierung in verschiedenen High-Tech-Bereichen herzustellen. Mit einem Team von mehr als 120 Experten und der Erweiterung der Produktionskapazit√§ten durch ein neues Werk im Technologiepark Berlin-Adlershof im Jahr 2020 setzt SENTECH auf stetiges Wachstum und Innovation in der Branche.

SENTCH Instruments GmbH sucht einen Prozessingenieur (m/w/d) f√ºr Plasmaprozesstechnologie, der Teil eines dynamischen Teams werden m√∂chte, das kontinuierlich zur Weiterentwicklung modernster Technologien beitr√§gt. Wenn Sie Ihre Fachkenntnisse in einem innovativen und zukunftsorientierten Unternehmen einbringen m√∂chten, freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbung!

Aufgaben

  • Anwendung und Entwicklung von Plasma√§tzprozessen in der Mikro- und Nanostrukturierung (RIE und ICP-RIE)
  • Durchf√ºhrung von Kundenapplikationen und Ger√§tevorf√ºhrungen im Applikationslabor
  • Eigenst√§ndige Planung und Durchf√ºhrung von Versuchsreihen mit deren Auswertung und Zusammenfassung f√ºr Kunden, Partner und Kollegen
  • Messtechnische Charakterisierung und Analyse von Proben (REM, Ellipsometer, Profilometer, u.a.)
  • Betreuung von Forschungs- und Entwicklungskooperationen mit internen und externen Partnern
  • Durchf√ºhrung von Schulungen und Prozessabnahmen beim Kunden vor Ort
  • Fachliche Unterst√ºtzung des Marketings und des Vertriebs
  • Besuch von Fachtagungen und Konferenzen

Profil

  • Abgeschlossenes Hochschul- oder Fachhochschulstudium im Bereich der Naturwissenschaften oder Ingenieurswissenschaften (z.B. Physikalische Technik oder Elektrotechnik), mit Vertiefung Halbleiter-, D√ºnnschicht- oder Plasmaprozesstechnik
  • Erfahrung im Plasma√§tzen (z.B. Halbleitertechnologie oder Mikro- und Nanooptik)
  • Praktische Erfahrungen mit Vakuumtechnik und D√ºnnschichtanalytik
  • Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
  • Routinierter Umgang mit der g√§ngigen MS-Office-Standardsoftware
  • Bereitschaft zu gelegentlichen Dienstreisen und F√ºhrerschein Klasse B

Wir bieten

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.
